messages.title: Warm welcome for Army Families
messages.content: Some of the army families from the Royal Scots Dragon Guards and Close Support Battalion Royal Electrical and Mechanical Engineers who were over staying in St Andrews for a week, as they visited the area and some of the schools, were given a very warm welcome to North East Fife. The visit was in advance of the move to Leuchars Base in July by the Army units based at Fallingbostel in Germany.

messages.title: Road Safety Improvements
messages.content: A pedestrian crossing has been approved for Hepburn Gardens by the War Memorial and also to the Car Park area. This should make it safer for pedestrians.

messages.title: West Sands Play Area
messages.content: The play equipment, which has been at the West Sands for some time, is now required to be replaced and Cllr Melville has asked for a report on the costs for funding this.

messages.title: Lade Braes repaired
messages.content: Repairs to the wooden bridge on the Lade Braes, which were due to be done at the end of last year, have finally been completed.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: CASH BOOST TO FIX OUR NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Liberal Democrats are the only party to have a fully worked out plan to meet the future funding needs of the NHS and improve the quality of treatment.
Scottish Lib Dems have challenged Fife College to expand further education provision in North East Fife following concerns that students cannot access the courses they want at the Elmwood campus.
Fife Liberal Democrats have welcomed the introduction of free school meals for all Fife pupils in their first primary year of school.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Lib Dems cutting the cost of living
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Lib Dems have implemented various policies to reduce the cost of living, including an £800 tax cut for workers, pension rise for all pensioners in North East Fife since 2010, and £50 cut in energy bills through reduction in energy company obligations.

mentions.partyLeader: Sir Menzies Campbell MP, Cllr Tim Brett and Willie Rennie MSP

issues.education: Fife Liberal Democrats have welcomed the introduction of free school meals for all Fife pupils in their first primary year of school.
issues.health: Liberal Democrats are the only party to have a fully worked out plan to meet the future funding needs of the NHS and improve the quality of treatment.

politicalExperience.achievements: Road Safety Improvements, West Sands Play Area proposal, Lade Braes repairs
